comments.body: Whats with all this stuff about the beginning dimension?  I've seen this alot and I don't see this happening.  Although a water dimension would be quite cool, just a different name to suit it, thats all.

I always assumed the next dimension would be a skyland and I think that's for good reason, we already have plenty of aquatic stuff thanks to 1.13 and a whole new dimension devoted to something not new seems like a bit of waste, it would just recycle mostly old material and game mechanics.

I think that the best way to add a more challenging part of the oceans is caves, water caving is really pointless for almost the entire game and I think an interesting way to add would be a chance of a large and wide (several hundred blocks) cave spawning in semi-deep oceans under the gravel from y = 11 to y = 35. This could include swathes of bio luminescent animals like jelly fish and dangerous animals like eels to fight.
Maybe you need a new block crafted from conduit surrounded by prismarine to make this portal

The ocean just got overhauled and for some reason, it is still empty... the creation of this dimension would help add real reason to explore it, and the portal could be the reason for the structure found on top of the ocean monument.

A coral biome, where the ground is completely coral. Lantern Fish mob, would be cool here. Zombie Fish mob would also be cool. Lots of drowned zombies and maybe even ship wrecks, the ships were somehow teleported to this dimension, and then were wrecked.

This would be a cool dimension to add after the sky dimension, which is almost a guarantee that they are going to add it at some point, but I think the overworld and end dimensions need more updates first. Then we would have the four elements for planes, and the end.

OMG just remembered (yes, I'm back) the 4 new paintings!

Earth=Overworld=Warden.( Don't know why guardians are here but maybe the way to enter the water world is tied into ocean monuments)

Water=a new dimension?=a new boss like the guardian but more powerful.

Fire=Nether=Wither.

Air=End=Enderdragon.
Ok this time I'm going

Ooh, that's really cool! I like the idea of a new boss- maybe a giant water dragon or an eel of some sort? I think that the best way to enter the water dimension would be through a portal either in the top of the ocean monument (if it isn't being used for something already) or somewhere inside it. I think that the plants would be really cool to have, because I've always liked ocean plants. All in all, your ocean dimension is a reel-ly awesome idea!
And to make this you would have to beat the end so its hard to get to the dimension

Perhaps could only make the portal in the end; also, it needs a more appealing dynamic like not just pets but every mob that has died is here, making it all the more hard because basically the player will have to fight undying mobs (once killed they respawn again); which makes this dimension a prefect experience farm.
I agree with Psychopirath
Just tame a new dog

some extra suggestions to add on:

-make it so that only nametagged pets will go to that demension , else some one could just spam the demension with random cats , and then it will be hard to find ur own pet back

-give the demension dead tree,s i geus it will be good fitting

-in case some one killed the pet himself , make it so that there is a 50% chanche that the pet will be angry at u and start attacking its specific killer

 

(but i would understand if this all will be to much trouble for the mojang team)
It could also include some monster like a ghost variation. Maybe a new type of zombie, that is black, with red eyes.
Dead trees, huge witch huts with mini bosses (new witch, but powerful and a different look, witch huts are bigger in size, are on the ground, not high off the ground like current ones.)
How About "Eerie Woods"? dark forest is already a biome
This is giving me chills... I LOVE IT!

I think that would be great

Pale garden should be upgraded:

  • fog,
  • fireflies (they should looks like eyes of new mob Creaking to confuse players),
  • trees should be new and unique,
  • more vegetation and flowers (i saw on Reddit someone proposed chrysanthemums)
  • and there has to be new structure (probably maze or something).
  • Maybe add new armour trim or decorative pots shard and it will be great update
It's supposed to be inspired from a willow tree, so they could use a texture tweak to look more like them.
Warden dimesion go brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

I  REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY want a warden dimension, kind like the nether, maybe instead of lava its oceans of poison water caused by the sculk. Maybe some new sculk arumor to help just a little against the warden but you gotta defeat one first. maybe some weird new trees as well. Warden is my favorite mob and i have tons of ideas for his dimension.

I really hope The End gets updated in the future, it's one of those areas in Minecraft that desperately needs an update. It needs to feel like a new beginning for the game. Challenging mobs and huge dungeons, unique equipments, biome variety, Endermen merchants to trade... or something that excites the community like bosses and rideable dragons!

Java strongholds should also generate infinitely like in Bedrock edition, that way far-away bases can still access The End.
I posted an idea of the Void dimension where you defeat the ender dragon 100 times to unlock the gateway.
Yeah I Only Go To The End To Find Elytra And Beat The Ender Dragon So Mybe An End Update Will Be Really Cool !
I think Microsoft should take some advice from the better end mod, and add it into vanilla Minecraft.

You read my mind. This is great. Maybe this update could come before the cave and cliff update to occupy players while it (Cave and cliff) is in development. However, the badlands wouldn't be able to be in the update or else it would come before the mountains. It has been long enough since the savannah and desert features were added and i think this is a great idea.
Everyone should know about this.
These three biomes lost in past biome votes, I totally doubt they’ll be updated any time soon..

Yes but they will someday. Doing it before the cave update could keep players busy with these features while the cave update is in development. Everyone vote to get ostrich and merekat into minecraft. It has been long enough. The ostrich is also my favorite animal.

I'm not even joking right now I was just about to post something almost the exact same, I also think in the 1.21 mob vote we can vote for the armadillo if it wins it would fit perfectly into this update
True, Mojang Studios do not need to study about it. Need add it ingame. It's logic !!
Good idea!

I like this idea! but I'm gonna give you more suggestions:

-There should be a new kind of tree just called "Star tree" It will have purple wood and leaves made out of stars. You can get Star apples from them and would teleport you like Chorus fruit but will grant you special effects.

-Star Valley should have its own grass block, It would be purple and will have stars on top of it.

-There should be Structures specific on this biome, There should be loot and a new type of hostile mob. There should be two enchantment that is found very rarely inside loot chests, One of them is "Bane of Enders" which would be a sword enchantment that deals damage specific to ender mobs (Endermen, shulkers, the dragon...) The other enchantment called "Endereye" would be a helmet enchantment that would give a chance that an enderman wouldn't become hostile at you while looking at them for a second.

-There should be Stars on the sky specific on this biome.

-There would be huge mountains which would be sub biomes to Star Valley.

-And finally, there should be a purple bamboo sub biome.
maybe there could be bat-like hostile mobs in this dimension?
What about giant spiders that crawl on the underside of the islands?

This dimension would satisfy hardcore minecraft players! The End is cool, but not so hard for veterans and the like. This would be a place that is chaotic and practically impossible to live in! Maybe demons or dragons could roam here too, just to make it even more crazy!
This dimension would be accessable only in hard and normal mode (hard having the chance higher).
Me párese muy bien con algún que otro detalle pero me parece excelente
Or, to enter this dimension, you would automatically be brought in if you waited in a Nether Portal for too long after traveling dimensions.
Or, to enter this dimension, you would automatically be brought in if you waited in a Nether Portal for too long after traveling dimensions.

Continuing on from the last sentence.
Vines would be renamed straggling vines and will take a little longer to cut. The vines will pull you up and slowly start reducing your health when you reach the top.
You will actually be able to set your spawn in thule.
Thule would have demons roaming freely from rifts.These rifts need to be enclosed completely with 2 blocks of space between the rift and the enclosed asap as the emerging demons would hunt unsworn.
The rift would shut after a day of being enclosed.
There would be new weapons obtainable from survivors such as spears and hammers. Spears could be thrown and could also be used in hand. Hammers could stun mobs momentarily.
Some large caves may house a few unsworn villagers who would use a main campfire at the centre of the cave as well as lanterns to keep hostile mobs from spawning and would use tools to kill those who spawned.
THAT, IS, AWESOME!!!!!

It's a bit generic, though... could use more details. But it's a good start!

Zombified piglins in spike doesn't make sense, though, since they're probably going to be more efficiently found elsewhere in the Nether...

Keep it up, though! This post definitely has potential.

So let's say you break one of them open, and there's half a stack of gold/iron ore in it.

Make the obsidian a few layers thick so it's actually hard to get inside, but if you have an efficiency 5 pickaxe then that is the best mining spot for you
Add a new mob too and I'm in!
Maybe obsidian hills? And then in between 2 obsidian hill biomes would be a soulsand valley but definitely add the obsidian spikes biome

I also think there should be alien markings but maybe thats too modern. I think scarecrows should be called golems instead, just an idea, and crows should avoid them.

1. coal

Anywhere mountainous

I like this idea too. I also think they should re-add the ability to choose how much ore is generated globally like in Customized Worlds (which was removed). 

I regularly start a new world, especially when a new update is released, so hopefully something happens with ore generation at some point so that we can choose how long it takes us to find ore.

At the moment in survival it takes too long to find rarer ores imo. I also like survival mode the best, so was not happy when Customized Worlds was removed. I understand why, but they said the'd put it or something like it back, but nothing so far and no word on it either, so i'm worried. 

Hope we get some info on this soon as I have asked in various places, but no one has answered sadly.

I think this should be done in connection with the addition of underground biomes. Ore rates should be more exclusionary of each other, and certain ore types should occur at more mid-range levels (not just the bottom of the world), depending on the biomes. Basically, you should be able to target specific ores if you know what to look for on the surface and underground. Doing so should make a big enough difference that you would distinguish between a redstone mine and a gold mine. Not doing so should tend to result in an poor return rates.
Cool idea; totally should be a thing. But you'd think it could easily become very cheaty. People use websites to find slime chunks, so couldn't people also use websites to find a diamond chunk?
I like this a lot. It would incentivize building coal mines, and iron mines, and they'd actually be functional!

Nathan lewis, those people you are taking about that use website to cheat already use them to find mansions, strongholds, nether fortresses, mob spawners and end cities, so adding diamond chunks wouldn't make too much of a difference anyway.
A solution is here.

Also the inside of meteors should contain either 4 diamond blocks or 4 emerald blocks in my opinion.

Found this post because I wanted to see if someone had already suggested pine nuts as a food item. What if this biome replaced the current old growth pine taiga? I don't remember hearing about this tree before, so I agree that Minecraft including it would help others learn about it - especially since the quick search I did confirmed that the Araucaria angustifolia is critically endangered!

araucarias are more common in the cold climate of southern Chile and Patagonia , similar to the tundra biome but mixed with jungle, with rhea, guanacos and pumas, various types of deer, salmon and sea lions

There should be like only some trees in some biomes, so per biome there would be a araucaria tree that stopped Pine nuts and sometimes rotten Pine nuts, also as a real Brazilian i have some experience with this type of tree.
I think the name should be the Blazing Hollows, because that seems to fit the description better.
Thanks for the input. Blazing hollows sounds just about right actually. Not sure why I didn't think of it earlier.

I am not too keen on the idea of lots if ores but I do like the theme. We have Soulsand Valley and Basalt Deltas which are colder seeming biomes, the two Forest biomes which are medium and we have the Wastes which are hot. But they are bland and a bit plain so I think that these ‘Blazing Hollows’ make for a good change up. The Nether is supposed to be the burning underworld but I fear it is becoming too hospitable in the new update; a new, unreckonable danger in the deeps would certainly make the Nether a challenge again.
Sounds perfect! You’ve got my vote!
